introduction.title: Vietnamese Questions
content: Vietnamese has three main types of questions: questions with question words (wh-questions), yes-no questions, and rhetorical questions.

Unlike English, Vietnamese question words stay in their logical position in the sentence—there is no 'wh-movement' to the front. Yes-no questions are formed by adding particles at the end of statements.

questionTypes.title: Questions with Question Words
questionTypes.description: Vietnamese question words (what, who, where, when, why, how) stay in their logical position in the sentence. This is called 'wh-in-situ'—the question word remains where its answer would appear.

questionWords.example: Bạn làm gì? (You do what? = What are you doing?)
Ai đến? (Who comes? = Who is coming?)
Đây là sách của ai? (This is book of whom? = Whose book is this?)
Bạn ở đâu? (You at where? = Where are you?)
Bạn đến khi nào? (You come when? = When will you come?)
Tại sao bạn học tiếng Việt? (Why you study Vietnamese?)
Bạn cảm thấy như thế nào? (You feel how? = How do you feel?)
Bạn làm bằng cách nào? (You do by method what? = How do you do it?)
Bạn thích cái nào? (You like which? = Which one do you like?)
Cái này giá bao nhiêu? (This price how much?)

patterns.title: Question Word in Logical Position
patterns.description: The question word stays where its answer would appear in a statement. This is the most common pattern.
patterns.structure: Subject + Verb + [Question Word at answer position]

examples.notes: Question word 'gì' stays in object position where the answer would be

examples.vietnamese: Anh ấy mua cái này ở đâu?
examples.notes: Question word 'đâu' stays in location position

patterns.title: Question Word as Subject
patterns.description: When the question word is the subject, it naturally appears at the beginning of the sentence.

examples.notes: When question word is subject, it's at the front naturally
Subject question word at the beginning

questionTypes.title: Yes-No Questions
questionTypes.description: Yes-no questions are formed by adding particles at the end of a statement. Different particles convey different levels of certainty or expectation.

particles.example: Bạn thích du lịch không? (You like travel not? = Do you like traveling?)
Bạn là sinh viên phải không? (You are student right? = You're a student, right?)
Bạn thích cà phê đúng không? (You like coffee correct not? = You like coffee, don't you?)
Anh sẽ đến phải chứ? (You will come right? = You'll come, right?)
Đây là cách tốt nhất đúng chứ? (This is way best correct? = This is the best way, isn't it?)
Tôi ngồi đây được không? (I sit here okay not? = Can I sit here?)
Tôi có thể mượn sách này được chứ? (I can borrow book this okay? = I can borrow this book, right?)
Ngon chứ? (Delicious? = It's delicious, isn't it?)
Trời đẹp nhỉ? (Weather beautiful huh? = The weather is nice, isn't it?)
Bạn đi Việt Nam hả? (You go Vietnam really? = You're going to Vietnam?)

examples.notes: Neutral question, no assumption about answer

examples.vietnamese: Bạn thích du lịch đúng không?

examples.english: Can I sit here? / May I sit here?
The weather is nice, isn't it?

questionTypes.title: Rhetorical Questions
questionTypes.description: Rhetorical questions express opinions or feelings without expecting an answer. They're commonly used in writing and speeches to engage the reader or create emphasis.

phrases.example: Chẳng phải chúng ta cần thay đổi sao? (Isn't it we need change? = Don't we need to change?)
Có lẽ nào anh không biết điều này? (Could be you not know this? = How could you not know this?)

phrases.english: could it be...? / is it perhaps...?
phrases.example: Phải chăng đây là điều chúng ta đang tìm kiếm? (Could be this is thing we are seeking? = Could this be what we're looking for?)
Liệu rằng chúng ta có thể thành công? (Wonder if we can succeed? = I wonder if we can succeed?)

examples.vietnamese: Chẳng phải đã đến lúc chúng ta phải hành động?
examples.english: Isn't it time we take action?
examples.literalEnglish: Isn't it has arrived time we must act?

examples.vietnamese: Có lẽ nào bạn không biết điều này?
examples.english: How could you not know this?
examples.literalEnglish: Could it be you not know this?

examples.vietnamese: Phải chăng đây là ý nghĩa thật sự của cuộc sống?
examples.english: Could this be the true meaning of life?
examples.literalEnglish: Could it be this is meaning true of life?

examples.vietnamese: Liệu rằng ngày mai sẽ tốt đẹp hơn?
examples.english: I wonder if tomorrow will be better?
examples.literalEnglish: Wonder if tomorrow will beautiful more?
examples.notes: Expressing hope or contemplation about the future

practiceSentences.vietnamese: Bạn có thích cà phê không?
Chúng ta đi bây giờ được không?
Bạn học tiếng Việt ở đâu?

practiceSentences.english: This dish is delicious, isn't it?
